intro: Macrosolen curtiflorus, commonly known as the narrow-flowered macrocystis, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or along streambanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive, mild parsley-like scent. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
